meanings.definition: The state or quality of being tightly packed together.
meanings.sent1: The serriedness of the books on the shelf made it hard to find the one I needed.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers stood in serriedness, shoulder to shoulder, ready for inspection.
meanings.sent3: The serriedness of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to fit them together.
meanings.sent4: The serriedness of the trees along the path created a tunnel of green.
meanings.sent5: The serriedness of the crowd at the concert made it difficult to move.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging closely together in a line or mass.
meanings.sent1: The serriedness of the chairs in the waiting room left no space for additional seating.
meanings.sent2: The serriedness of the cars in the parking lot made it hard to maneuver through.
meanings.sent3: The serriedness of the vegetables in the grocery store display was visually appealing.
meanings.sent4: The serriedness of the ants marching in a line fascinated the onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The serriedness of the buildings in the city skyline was impressive.
